items.title: Travis CI with Ruby 1.9.x fails for recent pull requests
items.body:
Hi,

there are a few recent pull requests that are failing on Travis, but only for the Ruby 1.9.x environment. The Ruby 1.8.x builds work fine.

Here is the trace that shows the error:
```
/home/travis/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.3-p194/gems/cocoapods-0.16.0.rc3/lib/cocoapods/command/error_report.rb:79:in ``': No such file or directory - sw_vers (Errno::ENOENT)
	from /home/travis/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.3-p194/gems/cocoapods-0.16.0.rc3/lib/cocoapods/command/error_report.rb:79:in `host_information'
	from /home/travis/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.3-p194/gems/cocoapods-0.16.0.rc3/lib/cocoapods/command/error_report.rb:30:in `report'
	from /home/travis/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.3-p194/gems/cocoapods-0.16.0.rc3/lib/cocoapods/command.rb:87:in `rescue in run'
	from /home/travis/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.3-p194/gems/cocoapods-0.16.0.rc3/lib/cocoapods/command.rb:71:in `run'
	from /home/travis/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.3-p194/gems/cocoapods-0.16.0.rc3/bin/pod:16:in `<top (required)>'
	from /home/travis/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.3-p194/bin/pod:23:in `load'
	from /home/travis/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.3-p194/bin/pod:23:in `<main>'
```

Not sure if this is actually the right place for reporting the issue :)

items.title: Install error with Ruby 2.3.0
items.body:

`pod install` command works well with Ruby 2.2.3.

$ ruby -v
ruby 2.3.0p0 (2015-12-25 revision 53290) [x86_64-darwin15]

items.title: Do a search on GitHub for issues relating to a crash?
items.body:
I'm sure I've seen this in a ruby tool  ( maybe @krausefx's fastlane? ) but taking the 2.3.0 issue as an example:

What if we took the first 3 or 4 words from the error and searched for issues for that: so taking this issue https://github.com/CocoaPods/CocoaPods/issues/4748

Crashing line: `NoMethodError - undefined method 'to_ary' for #<Pod::Specification name="iVersion">'`
Assuming the `NoMethodError` is already a separate token of the error if we just did a search for `undefined method to_ary`:

https://github.com/CocoaPods/CocoaPods/search?q=undefined+method+%60to_ary%27&type=Issues&utf8=✓ this gives us 12 results

We could probably reduce a lot of issue churn by having it automatically search like this in the exception.
